Welcome to RISK Tutorial mode! This game mode intends to teach you the basics of the game and
provide an understanding of how to play a match of risk. We start with the claim phase, each
player takes turns placing one troop on one unclaimed country. Try it out by clicking on the
highlighted country.
Once all countries are claimed, each player gets an additional amount of troops depending on
the amount of players in the game which they can use to strengthen their countries. Notice
how the other player has almost taken over South America. Try to prevent the bot from
succeeding, but also get ready to take over Argentina. Owning entire continents nets you more
troops per round!
Now the game can begin! There are three phases each round: Reinforce, Attack, Fortify. Let's
check them out. At the beginning of each reinforce phase, you get a certain amount of troops
and can place them on any of the countries that belong to you. Let's prepare to take over
Australia.
Now we get to the attack phase: Select a country you own, then select one of the adjacent
enemy territories and choose with how many troops you want to attack. Once you confirm your choice, dice are rolled to
decide a winner. If the attacker wins, they must choose an amount of troops to move to the
defeated country. Here, it would make sense to move fewer troops, as Indonesia is the only
bordering country protecting the continent.
Finally, the fortify phase: The player has the ability to pick exactly one country and
move some of its troops to an adjacent country. Sometimes, retreating is the better choice.
Seeing as how South America will be lost soon move your troops back towards North America to
reduce your total troop loss.
Notice how the enemy has split his troops almost evenly between Venezuela and Brazil. These
two countries are important as they are the borders of the continent. Having a high amount of
troops on such countries gives you a higher chance of defending the continent successfully.
Especially important, since the enemy now has control over South America!
Over the course of the game, if you conquer a country during the attack phase you will
receive a random card at the end of your turn. At the beginning of a turn you have
the ability to swap 3 cards, which match specific rules, and get extra troops in return for
your reinforce phase. Right now, you have the chance to try out swapping cards. Make sure
to read the rulebook for an explanation of the card-swapping rules.
In addition to the extra amount of troops, which is now even higher since you own Australia,
which you receive at the beginning of each round, you automatically get more troops on the
countries represented on the cards you swapped in and get an additional amount of troops to
distribute as you choose.
That's all for our introduction to the game RISK. You can now play this specific match further
with a bot of your chosen difficulty or practice matches
